update.description:
Homebrew just upgraded to boost 1.58. There is an added feature that causes a [test failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-default-devel-homebrew-amd64/15/testReport/). In 1.57 and earlier, hexadecimal values couldn't be parsed to floating point variables, while now it appears that they can be parsed. So I check the boost version and change the expectations accordingly.
~~~
src/UNIT_Param_TEST 
[==========] Running 6 tests from 2 test cases.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 5 tests from Param
[ RUN      ] Param.Bool
[       OK ] Param.Bool (1 ms)
[ RUN      ] Param.HexInt
Error [Param.cc:330] Out of range. Unable to set value [0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff ] for key[key].
[       OK ] Param.HexInt (0 ms)
[ RUN      ] Param.HexUInt
Error [Param.cc:330] Out of range. Unable to set value [0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff ] for key[key].
[       OK ] Param.HexUInt (0 ms)
[ RUN      ] Param.HexFloat
/Users/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/Param_TEST.cc:148: Failure
Value of: floatParam.SetFromString("0x01")
  Actual: true
Expected: false
/Users/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/Param_TEST.cc:150: Failure
Value of: 0.0f
  Actual: 0
Expected: value
Which is: 1
Error [Param.cc:330] Out of range. Unable to set value [1.0e100 ] for key[key].
[  FAILED  ] Param.HexFloat (0 ms)
[ RUN      ] Param.HexDouble
/Users/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/Param_TEST.cc:170: Failure
Value of: doubleParam.SetFromString("0x01")
  Actual: true
Expected: false
/Users/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/Param_TEST.cc:172: Failure
Value of: 0.0
  Actual: 0
Expected: value
Which is: 1
Error [Param.cc:330] Out of range. Unable to set value [1.0e1000 ] for key[key].
[  FAILED  ] Param.HexDouble (1 ms)
[----------] 5 tests from Param (2 ms total)

[----------] 1 test from SetFromString
[ RUN      ] SetFromString.Decimals
[       OK ] SetFromString.Decimals (0 ms)
[----------] 1 test from SetFromString (0 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 6 tests from 2 test cases ran. (2 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 4 tests.
[  FAILED  ] 2 tests, listed below:
[  FAILED  ] Param.HexFloat
[  FAILED  ] Param.HexDouble

 2 FAILED TESTS
~~~
update.title: Fix boost 1.58 test failure

content.html:
• utopic is happy
  • trusty is happy

Update as of 24ed793:

  • drone is happy
  • windows is ok

content.raw: i replaced `if` with `#if` and `else` with `#else` in 3393719 and 24ed793 and that seems to have fixed it
content.html: i replaced if with #if and else with #else in 3393719 and 24ed793 and that seems to have fixed it

update.title: Fix boost 1.58 test failure

content.raw:
An boost `#if` block would prevent the warning. The other alternative is:


```
#!c++

#ifdef _WIN32
__pragma(warning(push))
__pragma(warning(disable:4127))
#endif
  if (BOOST_VERSION >= 105800)
#ifdef _WIN32
__pragma(warning(pop))
#endif
```
content.html:
An boost #if block would prevent the warning. The other alternative is:

#ifdef _WIN32
__pragma(warning(push))
__pragma(warning(disable:4127))
#endif
  if (BOOST_VERSION >= 105800)
#ifdef _WIN32
__pragma(warning(pop))
#endif

update.title: Fix boost 1.58 test failure

content.raw:
CI status:

* [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/688)
* [homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/44/) with boost 1.58
* [windows says failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-windows7-amd64/43/) though it built successfully. It has [two new warnings](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-windows7-amd64/43/warnings34Result/new/) saying "conditional expression is constant". Should I be using compiler directives like `#if` for this?

all others pending
content.html:
CI status:

  • drone is happy
  • homebrew is happy with boost 1.58
  • windows says failed though it built successfully. It has two new warnings saying "conditional expression is constant". Should I be using compiler directives like #if for this?

all others pending

content.raw: [diff without whitespace](#!/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/181/fix-boost-158-test-failure/diff?w=1) to see that the expectations haven't changed for boost 1.57 and earlier
content.html: diff without whitespace to see that the expectations haven't changed for boost 1.57 and earlier
